senses.de: Something that is not correct, a wrong action or statement
senses.ex: She made a mistake in her calculations and we lost the game.

Tips.title: Apologies Expected
Tips.description: When acknowledging a mistake in English-speaking cultures, saying sorry is often expected.
Tips.example: I'm sorry, that was my mistake for not double-checking the report.

Tips.title: Learn from Errors
Tips.description: Discussing mistakes can be a sign of wanting to improve and not repeat them.
Tips.example: My last mistake taught me to always verify my sources.

Tips.title: Politeness Factor
Tips.description: Using 'small', 'tiny' or 'slight' before 'mistake' can make it sound less severe.
Tips.example: There’s a small mistake here; you forgot to include the date.

senses.de: To understand, judge, or identify something wrongly
senses.ex: I mistook you for my brother in the dark.

Tips.title: Identity Confusion
Tips.description: Mistaking people can lead to awkward social situations. Always clarify if unsure.
Tips.example: Oh, I'm sorry, I mistook you for someone else!

Tips.title: Context Clues
Tips.description: Pay attention to context to avoid mistaking things, like sarcasm for seriousness.
Tips.example: I mistook his sarcasm for sincerity and agreed with him.

Tips.title: Expect Corrections
Tips.description: If you mistake something, be prepared for someone to correct you. It's how you learn.
Tips.example: She corrected me when I mistook the plant for a weed.

senses.de: An action or judgment that is misguided or wrong
senses.ex: His mistake of fact led to a wrongful conviction.

Tips.title: Legal Ramifications
Tips.description: In legal contexts, a mistake can have serious consequences; precision is key.
Tips.example: Due to a mistake of law, the contract was deemed void.

Tips.title: Not Always Excusable
Tips.description: Claiming something was a 'mistake' doesn't always excuse legal or ethical responsibilities.
Tips.example: Despite his claims, that serious mistake cost him a penalty.

Tips.title: Factual Accuracy
Tips.description: Distinguishing between 'mistake of fact' and 'mistake of law' helps assess legal implications.
Tips.example: Her mistake of fact did not excuse her from the liability imposed by law.

Blunder.wordDefinition:
Blunder describes a more serious error, a mistake that was made due to careless, reckless or foolish behaviour.

It is a more severe form of mistake that often has negative consequences. For example, misinterpreting a client's request and delivering the wrong product or deleting an important file without backing it up would be considered a blunder.

To sum it up, mistakes are unintentional errors that can be forgiven, while blunders are careless actions that can lead to serious consequences.

Error.wordDefinition:
The words error and mistake are quite similar in meaning.

However, error usually refers to something that is done incorrectly because of a lack of knowledge or understanding, while mistake refers to a wrong action or decision made based on faulty judgment or misunderstanding.

For example, if someone solves a math problem incorrectly because they don't know the formula, that would be an error. If someone makes a decision to invest in a stock that later becomes worthless, that would be a mistake made due to faulty judgment.

Error tends to be more technical and scientific, while mistake is used in more everyday situations. But both words can be used interchangeably depending on the context.

Fault.wordDefinition:
Fault refers to a problem or flaw that is someone's responsibility or that they are to blame for. For example, if a car crashes because someone didn't look both ways before driving through a red light, it is their fault.

Fault is used when talking about something more serious or consequential, while mistake is used when discussing something less serious or accidental.

Lapse.wordDefinition:
A lapse is a momentary or temporary failure to behave or act in the expected or appropriate way.

It is usually unintentional and can be caused by forgetfulness, distraction or even exhaustion. For example, forgetting to turn off the oven after cooking or missing a deadline due to being too busy with other tasks could be considered a lapse.

A mistake is an error or fault caused by a wrong decision or an incorrect action taken by a person. Unlike lapses, mistakes can be intentional or unintentional, but they usually result from a lack of knowledge, misunderstanding, poor judgement or carelessness.

A lapse typically involves a brief moment of forgetfulness or inattention, whereas a mistake is a broader term that refers to broader misjudgements or errors in action or decision-making.

Misstep.wordDefinition:
Both misstep and mistake refer to an error or a wrong decision.

However, a misstep refers to a specific action or movement that was taken, while a mistake can refer to any kind of error, whether it be in action or decision-making.

For example, if you are dancing and you accidentally step on someone's foot, that would be a misstep. If you were to choose the wrong answer on a test, that would be a mistake.

A misstep is a more narrow term referring to a misstep in action, while a mistake is a more general term referring to any kind of error.

Oversight.wordDefinition:
An oversight is when you didn't realize something important that needed to be done or taken care of. It's not necessarily because you didn't know what to do or didn't do it correctly, but more because you just missed it.

For example, if you forgot to send an important email, that would be an oversight.

A mistake is doing something wrong because you didn't know how to do it right, whereas an oversight is forgetting to do something important that you actually knew you needed to do.

Slip.wordDefinition:
A slip is a mistake made due to lack of care or attention in a particular moment.

It is usually unintentional and can be a result of physical or mental factors. For example, spilling a drink, slipping on an icy sidewalk, or forgetting a word while speaking.

A mistake is usually related to knowledge or comprehension, while a slip is more related to a physical or mental action.

Both can happen to anyone, but a mistake can usually be prevented with more knowledge or attention, whereas slips may require more physical or mental abilities in the moment.

Your senses show you the world as it is. They aren't deceiving you, but sometimes they do. You might mistake a person far away for someone else,

videos.Text: He invented carpentry and all the tools used for it. He designed the first bathhouse and the first dance floor. He made sculptures so lifelike that Hercules mistook them for actual men.

quotes.Text: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're doing something.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Neil Gaiman

quotes.Text: I think is important to give a child room to make mistakes in order to learn. Mistakes build wings so later in life they can fly and go on their own. Let them fall once in awhile... Be their friend and parent as well. When they're in trouble, they will come to you first. Don't try to change their opinion.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Melania Trump

quotes.Text: I know that being seen as a role model means taking responsibility for all my actions. I am human, and of course, sometimes I make mistakes. But I promise that when I fall, I get back up.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jennifer Lopez

quotes.Text: You can live your life angry, bitter, mad at somebody or even guilty, not letting go of your own mistakes, but you won't receive the good things God has in store.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: When I woke up this morning my girlfriend asked me, 'Did you sleep good?' I said 'No, I made a few mistakes.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Steven Wright

quotes.Text: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
quotes.Title: Leader
quotes.Name: Buddha

quotes.Text: I've made a lot of mistakes in my life. I wouldn't say musically, though.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Future

quotes.Text: Your birth is a mistake you'll spend your whole life trying to correct.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.Text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.Text: I've made mistakes in my life for sure.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Kim Kardashian
